results.title: How to read biographies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
Shows how biographies may help in understanding history through the use of recreations from a number of biographies and autobiographies. Insights into the characters and philosophies of famous men and women are also given.

results.title: How to play cricket by Don Bradman
results.brief_description: This unique film was first produced in England in 1934 with the script written and spoken by Don Bradman. It has been updated with comments by Sir Donald, filmed at his home in Adelaide in May 1993. Provides a rare opportunity for cricket lovers to study the master batsman’s technique in detail, and is an invaluable coaching aid to any aspiring cricketer. Bradman’s test match career was an outstanding example of sporting brilliance; his career total of runs was 6,996 with an average of 99.9, including 29 centuries. Aggression, initiative and improvisation were the hallmarks of his playing and this footage, filmed on the London Cricket Ground in 1934, captures his style perfectly, shows the complete shot and stroke broken down into successive movements and as such provides an invaluable visual description of how to achieve maximum effectiveness and efficiency of movements when batting in a game.

results.title: How to organise your own music event (PC)
results.creator_credit: Diane Robbie, Malcolm Smith, Rory Sutton, AUSMUSIC, Global Vision and Songlines Music Aboriginal Corporation
results.brief_description: Organise your own musical performance with the assistance of Rocky the Roadie. The CD ROM covers all details in the organisation of a musical performance, including budgeting, choosing the right venue, promotion and fundraising. The CD is based on a module ‘How to Organise Your Own Music Event’, which is part of AUSMUSIC’s Certificate 2 in Music Industry Skills. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC with 486 DX2/66 or higher, 640x480 display with 256 colors, 8 MB RAM, 16MB of free hard drive space, 4 speed CD ROM drive, Microsoft Windows 3.1 or a later version, and Video For Windows. A 140 page student workbook plus teacher notes accompanies the CD ROM and provides an overview to the piece as well as a glossary of terms, references and useful contacts.

results.title: How to judge facts
results.brief_description: Designed to help students develop a technique for fact-finding, this film tells the story of a high school student who writes a sensational story for his school newspaper; his fellow students begin to learn to discount platitudes, false analogies, unfounded assumptions, and double meanings.

results.title: How to judge authorities
results.brief_description: A boy discovers a conflict between statements of “authorities” on a certain subject, and begins to make inquiries in order to evaluate the two statements. He considers the internal evidence on each “authority”, the experience from which each speaks, and the evidence of his own experience, in order to decide which, if either, “authority” is to be believed.

results.title: How to investigate vocations
results.brief_description: Intended to motivate youngsters to investigate vocations and determine the kinds of work for which they are best suited. The film illustrates how to interpret vocational guidance tests, how to apply their information to different vocations, how to raise questions related to a specific job and how to gain actual job experience by taking employment during vacations.

results.title: How to interview and hire the right people: a step-by-step guide for managers and supervisors: workbook [text]
results.brief_description: The right staff are asset to any business. This workbook, which accompanies the video set, enables managers to improve their skills in the interviewing and selection of staff.

results.title: How to interview & hire the right people. V.3
results.brief_description: In this seminar presentation with Stephen Carline, we learn powerful new ways to control the flow of information by using the key question guide to keep interviews on track in order to get the required information. We learn to compile and analyse the interview information to reach a smart hiring decision. Interview and hiring skills are too important to “pick up as you go”. This program provides complete and professional training in how to select employees who will contribute positively to your organisation.

results.title: How to interview & hire the right people. V.2
results.brief_description: In this seminar presentation with Stephen Carline, we learn effective ways of getting candidates to move beyond rehearsed answers and provide the “whole” truth and how to clarify and quantify reaction to each candidate. We learn to conduct an interview where everyone is comfortable and open through an interviewing system that stops the guessing games.

results.title: How to improve your squash
results.brief_description: Geoff Hunt, world champion, shows and tells beginners and squash players of all grades how to play and improve their game. Basic stroke play and game skills are examined thoroughly.
